Prerequisites.text: HFT 1000 and junior standing or C.I.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: An in-depth study of the theme park and attraction industry, focusing on resources, ride operations, merchandising, food services, and architectural design

Department.title: Department
Department.text: Department of Tourism, Events, and Attractions

Prerequisites.title: Prerequisites
Prerequisites.text: All courses in the Event Management core.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: The course focuses on the development, design, and evaluation of events that meet stakeholder needs and expectations. It incorporates a case study approach and requires 20 event volunteer hours approved by the professor.

Department.title: Department
Department.text: Department of Tourism, Events, and Attractions

HFT4758 - Operational Issues in the Them.name: HFT4758 - Operational Issues in the Theme Park and Attraction Industry

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Organizational structure and operational culture of theme parks and attractions

Department.title: Department
Department.text: Department of Tourism, Events, and Attractions

HFT4759 - Product Development in Theme P.name: HFT4759 - Product Development in Theme Parks and Attractions

Prerequisites.title: Prerequisites
Prerequisites.text: HFT 4755 and junior standing or C.I.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: The strategic management process associated with product development in the theme parks and attraction industry.

Department.title: Department
Department.text: Department of Tourism, Events, and Attractions

HFT4762 - Current Practices in the Airli.name: HFT4762 - Current Practices in the Airline Industry

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: A survey of the U.S. and International airline industry. Emphasis on the organization and management functions of the airlines.

Department.text: Department of Tourism, Events, and Attractions

Prerequisites.title: Prerequisites
Prerequisites.text:
Complete 1 of the following
Complete the following: 
HFT2071 - Introduction to the Entertainment Industry (3)
Or
Complete the following: 
HFT2750 - The Event Industry (3)

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: The course offers a comprehensive look at entertainment events with a focus on show development, event production, the creative process, casting, costuming, staffing, and evaluation.

Department.title: Department
Department.text: Department of Tourism, Events, and Attractions

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Considerations when planning events that are held outside of the United States or that attract a large number of participants from outside the United States.

Department.title: Department
Department.text: Department of Tourism, Events, and Attractions

Prerequisites.title: Prerequisites
Prerequisites.text: HFT 2750, HFT 3523, HFT 3670, and FSS 2284C, or C.I.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: The catering manager's role in the catering sales process. Emphasis on market segments, customer relationships, menu planning, financial impact, internal communication/documentation and event oversight.

Department.text: Department of Tourism, Events, and Attractions

HFT4856 - Event Food and Beverage Strate.name: HFT4856 - Event Food and Beverage Strategies

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: The course covers strategies required of event professionals tasked with the development and coordination of food and beverage functions in a variety of venues and settings.

Course Description.title: Course Description

Course Description.text: The production and service of malt beverages.

Prerequisites.text: HFT 1000 or CI; minimum age 21 on first day of class; students at least 18 but under 21 with CI.

Course Description.text: Using senses to evaluate wines, methodology of tasting and evaluating wines, growing, processing, and production of grape varieties used in making wine.
